description: The round payoff this round was 3. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -3000.

The game’s payoff structure is extremely punishing when both players choose option 2 – as seen in the memory, when both John and Kate chose option 2 with a round input of 3, the negative payoff was 3×1000 = –3000.

Each player’s default behavior (with Deepseek-R1 defaulting to option 1, and Kate knowing John’s default) introduces strategic tension. There’s a potential for one player to benefit by deviating (choosing option 2) if they expect the other to stick with option 1, yet mutual deviation can trigger a disastrous outcome.

The recorded round on 2024-01-02 serves as a cautionary example: when both players deviate to option 2 despite high risk, the result is a significant punishment, emphasizing the need to align expectations and perhaps adhere to safer strategies unless there is sufficient trust or evidence that the opponent will choose the safe option.
